definition: to act together/to put on a joint performance
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
variant of 合[he2]
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.english: Don't believe these superficial phenomena, he said. This is a drama co-acted by China and the US.
sentences.chinese: 别信这些表面现象，他说，这是一出中美合演的戏。

sentences.english: In another scene she is seen getting close to co-star Joshua Bowman.
sentences.chinese: 在另一场景，她被认为是越来越接近合演约书亚猎户。

sentences.english: We saw a film with a distinguished cast.
sentences.chinese: 我们看了一部名演员联合演出的电影。

sentences.english: The Indian Navy and the Coast Guards also have been holding routine joint exercises.
sentences.chinese: 印度海军和海岸卫队也一直在举行例行的联合演习。

sentences.english: Indian Navy and the Coast Guards also have been holding routine joint exercises.
sentences.chinese: 印度海军和海岸卫队也一直在举行例行的联合演习。

sentences.english: We played together in the provinces.
sentences.chinese: 我们曾在外省合演过戏。

sentences.english: Have we seen large, joint, sophisticated exercises?
sentences.chinese: 我们有看到过大规模复杂性联合演习吗？
